prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Collins Denny, Accession #2672-h, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Collection contains journal, 1867, of the Middle East voyage of William Ritenous Denny. Samuel Langhorne Clemens, was another passenger on the Quaker City. Also, article, 1967, on the Kercheval -- Hotsenpiller litigation by Elizabeth Chapman (Denny) Vann [12 l. photocopy (positive) 30 cm.] -- Charts, 1971, of Denny family genealogy by Mrs. Vann [3 p. photocopy (positive) 29 cm.] -- Clipping, 1956, from the Sheild of Phi Kappa Psi regarding New Jersey Alpha to which Denny belonged.

did.unittitle: Journal of William R. Denny's trip to the Middle East; 16mm microfilm of typed transcript ( ca.1955) 1867-1868

Article by Mrs. Vann re: "The Kercheval-Hotsenpiller Litigation ( ca.1797), (copy of article partly typed and partly manuscript)
ca.1967
3 genealogical charts of the Denny family prepared by Mrs. Vann. 1971
Issue of The Shield of Phi Kappa Psi. 1956 January
did.physdesc: (Xerox copy w/photographs of article about "New Jersey Alpha" to which Collins Denny belonged.)
